main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • main.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.util.Observable
    The Game Class for the game, it manages the Connect Four game.
    Author:
    C. Visscher and D. Ye

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(Player p0,
    Player p1)
        Creates a new Game class. It also creates a new instance of board and rules.
        Parameters:
        p0 - the first player to be inserted into the game.
        p1 - the second player to be inserted into the game.

      • getRules

        public Rules getRules()
        Returns the rules of the game.
        Returns:
        returns the rules

      • getCurrentPlayerIndex

        public int getCurrentPlayerIndex()
        Returns the index of the currentplayer from the players array.
        Returns:
        returns an integer of the current player. Returns either 0 or 1.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public java.lang.String getCurrentPlayer()

        public java.lang.String getNextPlayer()

        Sets the String of the winner.
        Parameters:
        winner - the winner

      • setCurrentPlayer

        public void setCurrentPlayer(java.lang.String name)
        Change the currentplayer to the given name, only if the given name in the players array.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the player you want to be the currentplayer.

      • setNextPlayer

        public void setNextPlayer()

      • getPlayers

        public Player[] getPlayers()
        Get all the players in the game.
        Returns:
        returns an array of Player.

      • readBoolean

        public boolean readBoolean(java.lang.String message)
        This method is used to read the input from the TUI. This method not used in the final project ConnectFour game. The method is only used when the TUI is implemented instead of the GUI.
        Parameters:
        message - the input from the player. Input has to be an index where the move is wanted. Or the input is a yes or no when the game is over and asked if you want to play another game.
        Returns:
        returns true if input equals yes.

      • start

        public void start()
        This method will run when a game instance is created.

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        Keeps checking if the game is over or not. The game is over when there is a winner or there is a winner and/or fullboard.

      • update

        public void update()
        Tells the current game situation and whose turn it is in the TUI.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the board and rules.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Prints out the result of the game when the game has ended.
